result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian R. Corvino was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:04 a.m. Defendant Brian R. Corvino in court with attorney Maggie Hogan.  Jillian Pfeifer, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bloom statement--reviews history of the case; interlocutory appeal; Court sees no Information in the record. State moves to amend charge in Information to reflect same charge included in original complaint, granted by the Court. Pfeifer speaks to prior agreement/just received the case. Hogan speaks to agreement with former ADA Bednar and now ADA Sowinski; speaks to mandatory minimum penalty. Hogan statement--defendant required to minimums; all procedural things in place for defendant to serve sentence in Dane County with ELM; approved by Oneida County Sheriff's Dept; aftercare compliance. Defendant pleads no contest. Plea Questionniare filed. Court reads on waiver of rights, and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds factual basis exists for plea and finds defendant guilty of OWI #4. Pfeifer defers to court. Hogan/Corvino statement to sentencing--Court statement. The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4). Cash bond applied toward fine. 

Court sentence
WHS
3 yrs. POP/allowed to serve through Dane County
6 mos. county jail w/Huber - may serve in any County, specific to Dane County upon approval; ELM granted or denied by sheriff of county serving jail time--report to Dane County Jail on or before 7:00 a.m. on 12/21/16
2 days' credit upon revocation
$2,009 fine all inclusive
IID 12 mos.
26 mos. d.l. revocation

Plea/Sentencing Hearing held March 10, 2015.
for State to file Information charging defendant with OW 4th offense within 5 yrs a Class H felony

11:10 am - Defendant Brian R. Corvino in court with attorney Timothy B. Melms.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Initially charged as 4th offense within 5 yrs - Felony.  Information filed charging 4th offense - Misdemeanor.  Bednar statement to amendment under 967.055(2) - potential removed for an acquittal, best for defendant/public for no felony conviction.  Melms states public interest is served by the plea agreement also sites 971.29.  Court cannot make finding under 967.055(2) where the amendment to a misdemeanor offense would be allowable.  Court will not approve Information as currently filed.  Court will draft written order and will set for a status conference.  Bail continued.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-10-2015 11:00 am

01:38 pm - Defendant Brian R. Corvino in court with attorney Timothy B. Melms.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bednar states an agreement has been reached - joint request for defendant to complete jail sentence in Dane County - Sheriff would like to speak with ADA Bednar prior to finalizing the jail sentence.  Both parties request adjournment.  Court addresses the change in charge which was amended down to OWI 4th - MIsdemeanor.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on January 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  State files Information.  Stuber - In receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty plea.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
